intro: Polyadenia cuspidata, commonly known as the bristly bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many species with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and pinnately compound leaves, with small, inflated pods that contain the seeds. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in early spring.
